original: Belanner, Adolf Ivar, fil. lic., Göteborg, f. 26/5/78 i Bälinge, Älvsb. 1. G. 11 m. Ester Beijerstein-Strömberg. Barn: Arne f. 13. — Stud :ex. i Skara 97, fil. kand. i Upps. 01, fil. lic. där 08, provår 09-10. Res." t. Engl. 03, Schweiz, Frankr., Engl. 09, Cambridge i Engl, Tyskl., Holi. m. stat. stip. 14, Tyskl., Österr., Ital. 21, Tyskl., Schweiz, Ital., Frankr. 29. Vik. lär. v. Gävle borg:sk. 03-05, e. o. lektor i Skövde 08-09, e. där. i Falun 10-12, vik. e. o. lektor i Lands’krona 12-13, adj. i Landskrona 12-43, timlär. v. komm:gymn. 21-29, v. lärl.- o. yrkes :-sk. 14-43, bibliot. v. lärov. 17-43, sekr. i lok:styr. 33-43, tryckfrih :omb. 21-43. Västg. nat. i Upps. andre kur. 08, förest, f. Falu föreläsn :anst. 10-11. Pens. 43. Excerpist f. Sv. akad. ord-b:arb. fr. 47. Sekr. i lok:fören. av lärov:lär. riksförb. o. av modersm:lär. fören. S-kr.: sko-luppl. av Puck of Pook’s Hill (15), ett flert. språkl. o. pedagog, upps. o. art. i facktidskr. o. dagspr. Hobby: ordförkortn. RVO.
translated: Belanner, Adolf Ivar, MA, Gothenburg, born on May 26, 1878 in Bälinge, Älvsborg. Married for the first time in 1911 to Ester Beijerstein-Strömberg, with whom he had one child, Arne, born in 1913. He took his student examination in Skara in 1897, obtained his bachelor's degree in Uppsala in 1901, and his MA there in 1908. He had a probationary period from 1909-1910. He traveled to England in 1903, Switzerland, France, England in 1909, Cambridge in England, Germany, Holland with state grants in 1914, and to Germany, Austria, Italy in 1921, Tyskl., Schweiz, Ital., Frankr. In 1929. He worked as a temporary teacher at Gävle borg:sk. from 1903-1905, was an acting lecturer in Skövde from 1908-1909, acting lecturer in Falun from 1910-1912, acting senior lecturer in Landskrona from 1912-1913, and teacher at a community high school from 1921-1929. He also worked as a librarian at a grammar school from 1917-1943, was the secretary of a local board from 1933-1943 and was a freedom of the press commissioner from 1921-1943. He was the second assistant at the Western National Insurance Company in Uppsala in 1908, head of the Falu lecture institute from 1910-1911 and retired in 1943. From 1947, he worked as an excerpiest for the Swedish Academy's dictionary. He was the secretary of a local association for school teachers and the national association for teachers of the mother tongue. He authored the school curriculum for "Puck of Pook's Hill" in 1915 and wrote several linguistic and pedagogical papers and articles in professional and daily newspapers. His hobby was abbreviation of words.

memberOf.name: National Association for Teachers of the Mother Tongue

creativeWork.name: School Curriculum for Puck of Pook's Hill
